title: Did you ever write a letter to anyone? - Quora

response.answer_text: When I was in 8th grade, I wrote a letter addressed to Obama and gave it to my English teacher to send it as she said she would. I wrote about the similarities in our backgrounds and how it makes me proud that someone like him made it to where he was and so on. I don’t think my teacher sent it though because she always tried to criticize him and plus when I had asked her 8 years later she said she actually didn’t to which I wasn’t much surprised but kind of disgusted. But my views on Obama started to change when I heard he called the previous Ethiopian regime a democratically elected one. I do not entirely blame the guy but BUT it really really angered me considering the fact the on of the main reasons I came to the US was to get away from that regime. Obama would have done a lot better if he addressed the issue without any equivocation - the issue being that the regime was a blood-thirsty and conniving one (even more so than one might actually think) that took whatever means necessarily to wipe out in standard and uniform manner its actual or perceived adversaries - be they young, old, female, male, disabled, abled and et cetera .

Yes I write many letters. I went to a church camp a while ago, now I go every year. The camp counselors are not allowed to give out their numbers but I asked one for her address, now we’re pen pals. Writing letters is quite enjoyable if you ask me. I also write letters to a lady at my church, we have a program called prayer angels, the youth pray for an adult and that adult prays for the youth. We’re supposed to keep in touch but I don’t really talk to adults because, well, it gives me anxiety. So I write to her, and she sometimes writes back. I enjoy writing letters honestly, and you may find this weird but licking the envelope to seal it is fun too. ~Aspen

Hi. Thanks for A2A Amit. Yes I did and I love writing letters actually. :) Sharing two of them here, with you. First one for my soulmate. To, My soulmate ❤️ Sometimes when I feel disheartened,I just listen to your songs. The songs you sang in your sweet voice. And that too in loop for hours. And you know after those long phone calls. My heart feels heavy every single time, to say 'bye'. I don't know and don't even wanna know , ‘Why not anyone else ever be able to understand me like you do?’ I'm blessed to have you in my life. You are such a precious present, I have got from God in this life. And I really wish to have you in my next life as well. From, Someone wishes to be yours. Second one is for my crush. An unsent letter to crush ❤️❤️ To, My Crush ❤️ Even if I don't see you everyday. Whenever I see your photo, which is on my desktop and phone's wallpaper, it takes me to another world. And you are on my mind every second of the day. My heart skips a beat even after getting a small text from you. I don't know what it is. But I wish to have you till the end of my life. From, Yours true admirer. Thank You. :) Hope you enjoyed reading them.

A2A This is by far the weirdest, funniest and most nostalgic request I got for an answer. I love writing letters for others and myself. I've written a letter to almost each and every person close to me. Sometimes I make little colorful origami envelopes in which I write letters for those very special to me. Those envelopes look exactly like these.  (Image Source: Origami Japan) The smile on their faces makes it worth every word. If someone is special to you, one of the best ways to express that is through a letter. Call me old-school but making it personal like that is really sweet. R aka Early Owl
